title: NASA and Boeing say preparations continue for July Starliner test flight
summary: NASA and Boeing said May 26 they are still working towards a July launch of the CST-100 Starliner on a crewed test flight despite “emerging issues” and concerns raised by a safety panel.

title: SpaceX launches Badr-8 to bolster Arabsat’s satellite fleet
summary: SpaceX launched the Badr-8 TV broadcast and telecoms satellite May 27 for Saudi Arabia-based fleet operator Arabsat, equipped with a jamming-resistant optical communications payload demonstrator.

title: NASA Sets Coverage for Axiom Mission 2 Departure from Space Station
summary: NASA will provide live coverage of the undocking and departure of Axiom Mission 2 (Ax-2) private astronaut mission from the International Space Station before crew returns to Earth.

title: Space Development Agency to launch 13 satellites in late June
summary: The Space Development Agency is preparing to launch at least 13 satellites in late June, the agency’s director Derek Tournear said May 26.

title: Falcon 9 launches Arabsat 7B following weather delays
summary: SpaceX finally launched the Arabsat 7B satellite to geostationary transfer orbit (GTO) for Arabsat atop its Falcon 9 rocket.
